title: Panic over 'None'

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:

```
error: Could not compile `rusemmo`.

Caused by:
  process didn't exit successfully: `rustc --crate-name rusemmo src/main.rs --crate-type bin --emit=dep-info,metadata -C debuginfo=2 -C metadata=8b4407e547170639 -C extra-filename=-8b4407e547170639 --out-dir /home/ubuntu/workspace/rusemmo/target/debug/deps -L dependency=/home/ubuntu/workspace/rusemmo/target/debug/deps --extern nphysics3d=/home/ubuntu/workspace/rusemmo/target/debug/deps/libnphysics3d-4df89cbaaf8f2c4a.rmeta --extern bcrypt=/home/ubuntu/workspace/rusemmo/target/debug/deps/libbcrypt-1d6f7263b0ed40ab.rmeta --extern redis=/home/ubuntu/workspace/rusemmo/target/debug/deps/libredis-7bbcbde683b68122.rmeta -L native=/home/ubuntu/workspace/rusemmo/target/debug/build/rust-crypto-1726770e89591a2e/out` (exit code: 101)
```
The code im running is closed source, and this is on the Nightly Build, and as i have no idea which part is causing it to panic like that, i wont reveal info unless asked. From what i can tell, someone forgot to check if a option would be 'None'
